snippet: The Daily has struggled to break into the national conversation or to drive news and build on its brand the way traditional outlets do.
abstract: News Corp's The Daily, a $30 million tablet-only news publication, has struggled to break into the national conversation or to drive news and build on its brand the way traditional outlets do; it has 100,000 subscribers paying 99 cents a week or $39.99 a year, and 250,000 unique readers monthly, putting it on target to break even in five years.
lead_paragraph: The Daily has struggled to break into the national conversation or to drive news and build on its brand the way traditional outlets do.

headline.seo: After a Year, The Daily Tablet Paper Struggles
headline.main: After a Year, Tablet Daily Is a Struggle
headline.print_headline: After a Year, Tablet Daily Is a Struggle
